match.title: 1st ODI
match.statusText: Sri Lanka won by 5 wickets (with 55 balls remaining)

image.caption: The inaugural One Day match at the Rangiri Dambulla International Stadium
image.longCaption: Sri Lanka v England first one day International played at the Rangiri Dambulla International Stadium, March 2001

dismissalText.commentary: Marvan Atapattu lbw b White 40 (89b 1x4 0x6 150m) SR: 44.94

notes: 12th men: TM Dilshan (Sri Lanka), MA Ealham (England)
England innings: 1x5 ball over (28th over, Arnold's 7th, called by umpire Jayasundara)
England 143 all out 48.5 overs 190 mins (R.R 2.94 per over)
Sri Lanka 50 in 55 balls 42 mins (Jayasuriya 39*, Attapattu 5*)
Sri Lanka 10 overs 50 runs 1 wkts 45 mins
Sri Lanka 20 overs 76 runs 4 wkts 94 mins
Sri Lanka 100 in 179 balls 136 mins (Attapattu 23*, Arnold 19*)
Sri Lanka 30 overs 100 runs 4 wkts 138 mins
Sri Lanka 40 overs 138 runs 5 wkts 186 mins
Sri Lanka won by 5 wickets (40.5 overs)

stories.title: Arnold steers Sri Lanka to a comfortable victory
stories.summary:
Sri Lanka won the first game of a three-match One-Day International series
by five wickets at the Rangiri Dambulla International Stadium today

stories.title: Arnold guides Sri Lanka to victory over England
stories.summary:
Sri Lanka won the first game of a three-match One-Day International series
by five wickets at the Rangiri Dambulla International Stadium today

stories.title: Arnold steers Sri Lanka to comfortable win over England
stories.summary: Sri Lanka celebrated the birth of their eighth international venue by clinching a comfortable five-wicket victory over England in the first One-Day International in Rangiri Dambulla International Stadium today
